availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Harrison Womack (Adair County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier (13th KY Inf))

body.p: Adair County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of Jesse WomaCk and Delila Womack. Married to Anna Bryant Womack in Adair County, Kentucky, on April 11, 1852. Father of Daniel M. Womack, Nancy L. Womack, John R. Womack, and William H. Womack. Farmer in Adair County in 1850. Farm laborer in Adair County in 1860. Served in the 13th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a private from December 31, 1861 to January 12, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Adair County, District 2, p. 81A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Adair County, Division 2, p. 56.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Adair County, White Oak, p. 140A.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0269.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Adair County Marriages, Film 000830576.
"Harrison Womack (1826-1912)," Find A Grave, Memorial 25370014, accessed April 4, 2022, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/25370014.
